Title: Patent Engineer
Description: We have an exciting opportunity for a patent engineer with an ICT/Electronic Engineering background to join our Singapore patents team. This role will challenge you to combine both hard skills: applying technical knowledge in a legal framework; and soft skills: interfacing with clients to understand and meet their objectives. The job would provide an opportunity to qualify as a Singapore patent attorney through supervision by qualified patent attorneys, requiring a number of years and personal commitment.       KEY RESPONSIBILITES     You will be assisting our patent attorneys by:     Reviewing invention disclosures, conducting pre-drafting prior art search to provide patentability advice, liaising with inventors to draft patent specifications. You will mainly be involved in ICT subject-matter such as blockchain, software development and applications, artificial intelligence, telecommunication data encryption Assisting clients with the prosecution of their patents in Singapore and overseas Conducting freedom-to-operate and/or invalidity searches Preparing invalidity and/or infringement opinions Assisting with patent litigation Assisting with patenting cost projections and marketing pitches Assisting with patent docketing management       QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE      Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering. Candidates with a degree in Electrical Engineering will also be considered. Preferably 1 to 2 years prior patent experience. Completed or going to complete GCIP is also preferred.       OTHER REQUIREMENTS      Excellent command of English Ability to communicate in and to read Chinese will be an advantage Strong willingness to learn independently about technologies in various fields and to adapt to changes in patent practice Ability to manage work flow and to prioritize deadlines Ability to eventually work independently with minimal supervision

Title: Data Analyst, Client Data Chapter (COO SG) (Associate/Senior Associate)
Company Name: Bank of Singapore, Asia's Global Private Bank
Description: Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities.   We are looking for Associate/ Senior Associate  for the newly created role of Client Data Chapter (COO Office Singapore)  , who will be using data analytics and data visualization to improve client data quality and supporting the Client Data Steward in driving data management initiatives in conjunction with front office (FO) and cross functional teams.   This is an essential role that supports Bank of Singapore‚Äôs ambition to be a data-driven company, leveraging high quality and timely client data and analytics to further advance our competitive advantage.   If you have a strong interest and the knowledge in using analytical tools to drive quality assurance, are passionate about driving data quality and process improvements, and have a knack for problem-solving, this is the opportunity for you.   You will support the Client Data Owners and the Client Data Steward in the following:    Data Management And Data Quality Issues (DQ)    Support the Client Data Steward on various Data Governance and Data Management initiatives including but not limited to the identification of significant deviations or gaps from the Bank‚Äôs data management policies, impact assessment, and escalation to the COO for decision. Ensure all prioritized DQ issues raised by FO or other functions are being incorporated and tested in the Data Detective Tool (DDT) Determine if the data anomalies can be immediately corrected or further prioritization is required Work with cross-functional teams to identify possible root causes from the exceptions detected by the DDT and/or DQ issues raised Investigate the appropriate corrective actions, including reviewing source documentation where required Perform the corrective actions, and where deemed required, recommend process or systems change or preventive controls Upon Data Manager‚Äôs approval, refine existing rules or add new rules to the DD tool due to 1) DQ issues raised by FO or other functions, 2) corrective/preventive actions taken, 3) any other product enhancements, or any other relevant inputs.    Data analytics and data visualization    Execute on a periodic basis the set of test rules from Data Detective Tool, a product of our in-house innovation initiative, to detect and generate report on client data anomalies Track open, in progress and closed DQ issues, and in various Dashboards and attestation responsibilities Design in Power BI dashboards to support SG COO monitoring and decision making Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent work experience required At least 3 years of experience relating to data management, data analytics, data visualisation or operations client onboarding within the financial industry Experienced in the private banking industry or CRM system a plus Able to conduct and apply quality testing approaches in day-to-day activities Good written and verbal communication skills Able to thrive in a team, is highly approachable and open minded Able to be proactive in establishing processes and adopting best practices Enjoys problem solving and uses strong analytical approach Proficient in MS Office, particularly Excel, PowerPoint and Power BI SQL and/or Python script basic knowledge appreciated   Primary Location  Singapore   Job  Data Management   Organization  Bank of Singapore Division   Schedule  Permanent   Full-time   Job Posting  18-May-2022, 11:22:38 PM

Title: Health Analytics Specialist
Description: Prudential's purpose is to help people get the most out of life. We will deliver our purpose by creating a culture in which diversity is celebrated and inclusion assured, for our colleagues, customers, and partners. We provide a platform for our people to do their best work and make an impact to the business, and in exchange, we support our people's career ambitions. We pledge to make Prudential a place where you can Connect, Grow and Succeed.   Job Profile Summary  As a part of this dynamic role, you will report to the Senior Manager Health Analytics (under the Medical Portfolio Management Department). In this role, you will be responsible for analysis and interpretation of health claims data received from our panel providers under our Shield business. You will be required to provide the business team with insights for process improvement and/or enhancements, leading to improved operational efficiency and delivery of customer centric solutions, from a health claims perspective. You will be required to provide support to Shield claims team in extracting and interpreting claims data and disseminating MIS to the Senior Management Team.   You will be expected to support cross-functional teams across Operations Division, in developing analytical capabilities and developing predictive models related to New Business Underwriting & Life Claims. Moreover, you will work closely with various internal stakeholders to manage adhoc requests that require special or delicate handling, compliant with internal policy and regulatory requirement and meet monthly service objectives (SLA).   Job Description   Perform in-depth quantitative analysis pertaining to PRUShield medical claims data, received from multiple sources, including but not restricted to Panel Hospitals / Specialists and Clinics Ability to analyse structured data and organise unstructured data into a workable format Assist Senior Health Analyst to produce and generate all BAU reports for panel partners and circulate data reports to relevant stakeholders on a timely basis Prepare and develop keynote instructions which outline steps involved in the production of high quality BAU reports Constantly update and maintain health analytics SOPs Conduct diligent data visualization on the claims dashboards and report any anomaly or unusual trend/s Support PRUShield Claims team in extraction and interpretation of monthly MIS reports, for circulation to Senior Management Team Analyse, develop, and deploy machine learning and optimization models that can successfully deliver innovative solutions to business problems, e.g. Fraud, Abuse and Waste Management (FAW); Chronic Disease Management Programme (CDMP) Continuously validate and test predictive models to maintain accuracy of the outputs Keep abreast of latest developments in the world of statistics and advanced analytics and subsequently ideate and implement the methodologies to solve potential business problems Ensure scripts and algorithms are scalable and usable with minimum intervention in the future    Cross Functional Collaboration   Provide and extend analytical capabilities to develop statistical models related to New Business Underwriting & Life Claims Work with other cross functional teams such as Data Analytics and OPEX CoE, to achieve common goals and objectives    Who We Are Looking For  Competencies & Personal Traits   Hands on expertise of Analytical tools such as SAS, SQL, R, Python, Alteryx etc. Ability to visualize data through BI tools such as Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau etc. Advance level proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Knowledge of Big Data platforms like Hadoop, Spark, Scala would be preferred Possess strong knowledge of methodologies applied in predictive analytics such as classification models, decision trees, neural networks, random forest, multivariate statistics etc. Aptitude to learn, think creatively to solve real world business problems, and work in a collaborative team environment Fluent in English, both spoken and written    Working Experience   At least 3-5 years of experience in Data Analytics/Data Science related roles. Title: Associate Analyst / Analyst (Customer Data Analytics)
Description: JOB SCOPE    Marina Bay Sands is the global benchmark for integrated resort development. We are committed to creating unforgettable memories for our guests and challenging the conventional thinking in the hospitality industry.   The sheer amount and variety of existing and new data collected in integrated resort industry is unprecedented. As this growth continues, so do the opportunities to capture the most value and meaningful insights from data and turn them into competitive advantages.   We are seeking an Associate Analyst / Analyst of Customer Analytics to join the Casino Analytics and Optimization team in Marina Bay Sands. The Customer Analytics team is a small yet highly autonomous group within the Casino Analytics and Optimization function. The team collaborates closely with the Sales, Marketing, IT, Digital, and Strategic Planning functions to apply advanced analytics to generate value-creating insights from big data. The ideal candidate is passionate about creating business impacts using data and industry experience. He/She has exceptional analytical skills and loves to solve problems with data. Strong communication and collaboration skills are required.    Job Responsibilities    The team is tasked with developing creative approaches to data sourcing, deriving new variables and factoring in qualitative insights to deliver high-impact business solutions.    Key Areas Of Focus, Include    Leverage customer data and analytics to acquire, develop, and retain high-value customers more profitably and effectively Work with the casino sales team to optimize structure, communication, and coverage Develop a robust behavioral and needs-based segmentation to create more relevant, actionable, and personalized campaigns, offers, and engagements Collaborate with the marketing technology team to enhance CRM and real-time rules capabilities    Analytics   Apply advanced analytics, modelling and machine learning on patron behavior, CLV prediction and profitability analysis. Translate modelling results and segmentations into business strategy via data/dashboards with impactful visualization.  Design data-driven personalized offers and A/B testing. Job Requirements    Degree in Business Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or other analytical fields preferred. Marketing graduates with flair for numbers and interest in customer and marketing analytics are welcome. 1 to 2 years of practical experience in business analytics, customer analytics or marketing analytics preferred. Fresh grads are welcomed to apply for Associate Analyst. 2 - 4 years of practical experience in business analytics, customer analytics or marketing analytics or Masters in any analytical field for Analyst. Experience building and implementing predictive models and machine learning will be an added advantage. Casino related experience is a bonus but not compulsory. Programming skills using analytical tools such as Base SAS, SAS EG, SQL, R or Python is required. Proficient in data visualization tools, such as Tableau preferred. Ability to process massive amounts of data and complete critical projects in a correct, accurate and timely manner. Strong logical thinking, data analysis and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Passionate about data, customers, and building your career with Marina Bay Sands.   You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

Title: Research Fellow (Computer Science)
Description: The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow.   The project investigates encoding and decoding of the functional and structural connectome by using graph neural network approaches. Encoding learns compact representations of the connectome, leading to disease classification, subtype identification, etc., and decoding is aimed at identifying key brain regions and connections implicated in brain diseases.   The Research Fellow is required to apply recent Graph Neural Networks such as GCN, GraphSAGE, and GAT for connectome analysis from fMRI and DTI scans and to handle key challenges to such approaches such as the lack of large imaging datasets and inconsistences across images gathered on multiple sites.    Key Responsibilities    Perform research on machine learning and deep learning methods for brain image analysis Develop the necessary routines in Python/R Lead a team consists of research staff and students and coordinate the project Publish research findings in key conferences and journals    Job Requirements    PhD degree in Computer Science or related field with machine learning and image processing background. Skills in Python/R programming is needed   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Title: Operations Specialist, Climate Projects
Description: South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all continents across the globe, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions, we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities.   Our Corporate Functions team is the ‚Äúenablement engine‚Äù of South Pole. Behind the scenes, we provide the business with world-class solutions and best practices that sustain business growth and success. We cover key areas such as Finance, HR, Office Management, Legal, IT, Operations, etc. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you!   Job summary:  As Operations Specialist, you will work within a global operations team supporting the Climate Projects Business Line. Specifically, you will work closely with the Portfolio and Procurement & Trading team taking on responsibilities to ensure efficiency in team performance and improve, update and maintain tools, processes and templates. You will contribute to our fast-paced growth by leading the onboarding process for new team members and delivering training and global learning sessions. Based in the APAC region, you will be responsible for addressing any local needs and supporting the region with daily operational support. This is a fast-paced role that requires cross-company collaboration, multi-tasking and prioritization.   Main tasks & responsibilities:   Continuously support improving internal tools, processes and templates as well as the supporting documents/guidelines Support the development of operational policies and procedures for teams in Climate Projects as well as assist with any day to day operational questions and issues Support the onboarding process of our new team members, through training on the business, tools and processes, and through the organisation of onboarding gatherings Work with the team members to address operational needs, such as problem-solving or being consulted as an expert for challenges with systems Organise, support and facilitate, as required, global and regional Climate Projects meetings. Including, note-taking, action tracking and facilitating team meetings. Organise, support and facilitate training of new or updated operations processes with the team in the region and globally as required Be the point of contact for operational issues, feedback and suggestions on tools and processes, and templates for the Climate Projects team in the region Be part of project teams with a global impact, for instance, support the scalability of the current way of working, improve communication structure between teams and streamline meeting cadences.    Essential profile requirements:   Bachelor or equivalent degree Entry-level relevant work experience Experience or interest in working within an international and multicultural context Comfortable operating in a fast-paced international environment Advanced skills with the use of the Google Drive, IT platforms and technology savvy Strong organisational skills and eye for detail Excellent personal relationships, enjoy working with and supporting others Process-oriented, with a taste for efficiency increase Excellent oral and written skills in English Able to perform data analytics Good prioritisation and time management skills A proactive, diligent and independent approach Eager to learn    What we offer:  At South Pole, we care about our employees as much as we care about the planet. South Pole is not just an employer, we are a Team. South Pole does not just offer people a job, we offer you a career. By joining our team, you will find strong purpose and deep meaning in everything you do. You will have the chance to make a real difference for our clients and for the planet, working alongside a passionate team of like-minded colleagues, while building your knowledge/skills and developing your career in a fun, dynamic, international and fast-growing organisation.   We‚Äôre a planet of 7.5 billion unique and different people. We all have a contribution to make and South Pole is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status or disability. Title: Media Analyst (Tamil Proficiency)

We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.   With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions  - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world‚Äôs most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making. We always strive to break new grounds, constantly focusing on solution-oriented approaches and at the same time developing every individual to his or her full capacity.   Role: Media Analyst (Tamil Proficiency)   What You'll Do    Conduct quantitative and qualitative media data analysis, for the purpose of providing clients with insight into their brand perception, media performance, competitor landscape, campaign performance, industry / consumer insights reports etc. Manage your portfolio of monthly/quarterly projects and ensure customer satisfaction throughout the delivery process Analyse mainstream media and social media content to draw meaningful insights which help with furthering our clients' strategic communications goals Utilise our Meltwater proprietary software, Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint extensively, to cover end-to-end process of extracting raw data, uncovering insights, and delivering reports in a digestible format to clients Play an integral role of working cohesively with your team to ensure all deliverables and tasks are completed in good quality and well within deadlines Brainstorm and strategize ways to evolve & improve report quality and objectives, catering to clients‚Äô changing requirements or feedback Work closely and interdependently with your internal team, Enterprise clients and Account Managers with a shared purpose of value-adding to clients    Who You Are    Strong proficiency in Tamil language (for translations into English) , and effectively bilingual in both English and Tamil language Able to work flexible hours / rotational shifts, & must be currently residing in Singapore Attained Bachelor's Degree (in any specialization) Entry level / have up to 1 - 2 years of relevant work experience (client facing roles is a plus) Proficient in using Microsoft Excel, Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, Microsoft PowerPoint, etc. Excellent report writing and presentation skills, with experience in both qualitative and quantitative reporting Keen interest in current affairs, mainstream media, and social media Derive great enjoyment being in a client servicing role with a naturally strong customer focus Able to think critically ‚Äì look at numbers, trends, and data and come to conclusions based on the findings Meticulous ‚Äì have an eye for detail, ensure data integrity & precision, and exercise vigilance in the analysis to come to correct conclusions Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Google Studio is a plus    What We Offer    Competitive remuneration package Fast career progression & empowerment in your role Flat hierarchy with diverse, high-performance & collaborative teams Global presence & a uniquely Meltwater culture like no other Both flexible work arrangements & vibrant offices with well-stocked pantries Generous vacation leave, birthday leave, maternity and paternity leave Work-life balance   Meltwater Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/   ()

Title: C++ Engineer, Calibration (Infrastructure)
Description: We are seeking talented C++ Engineers  to drive products that will shape the fast-moving Autonomous Vehicle (AV) industry, deliver a turnkey, fully autonomous driving system. Our team is working on applying state of the art research in machine learning, computer vision, 3D data processing and sensor fusion to solve challenging and exciting problems in the calibration domain.   Sensor calibration is one of the foundational building blocks of an autonomous vehicle (AV). In simple terms, sensor calibration informs the AV how its sensors are positioned on the vehicle within a high degree of accuracy. This allows the AV to perceive the world and its position in the world from multiple sensors, such as LiDARs, radars, cameras, and inertial measurement units (IMU) by bringing their readings into a common coordinate frame.   The candidate will join our team to build out the next generation technology stack to enable high throughput, un-supervised, scalable calibration products for autonomous vehicles. This includes maintaining, improving our factory indoor calibration products to ensure highly accurate and reliable calibration; and developing our outdoor calibration products that are quick and reliable to perform calibration in a wide variety of operating environments at deployment sites and on the road.    What You'll Get To Work On    Work with a multidisciplinary team to develop and maintain the calibration software stack for our autonomous vehicle fleet. Create and maintain development tools and infrastructure for autonomous vehicles. Perform prototyping, field testing, and system configuration. Productive and continuous feedback between stakeholders and end-users for improvement of the development lifecycle     Required Skills And Background    Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or a related field 2+ years of experience in professional software development in infrastructure Strong experience with modern C++ features, CMake, Boost and unit testing frameworks Experience working with sensors such as cameras, LiDARS, RADARs, autonomous technology, robotics, or other relevant experience Experience developing 3D graphics intensive applications for visualizations or simulations Experience managing, profiling, and optimizing experimental pipelines    Bonus   Passionate about scalability Experience with Bazel and Jenkins or other CI tools or cloud-based applications Expertise in one of the following field: probabilistic robotics, state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, or multi-modal sensor calibration Have a story to tell    In return you can expect   The opportunity to contribute to cutting edge research that will be implemented on an autonomous vehicle driving on public roads Work in an office filled with extremely self-driven and smart engineers and researchers from over 40 countries An office culture that cares about more than just work    Join us! At Motional, we're creating a future of transportation that is safe, reliable, and accessible.   Motional is a driverless technology company making self-driving vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.  The Motional team is made up of engineers, researchers, innovators, dreamers and doers, who together are creating a first-of-its-kind technology with the potential to transform the way we move. We're behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet.   As a leader in an emerging industry that has the promise of creating safer, more reliable and accessible transportation for all, it's imperative we have a diverse workforce, create an inclusive culture, and understand the communities we operate in around the world.   Diversity, Equity and Inclusion is fundamental to Motional's success. That's why we've established a team to ensure DEI is at the forefront of the candidate and employee experience, beginning with the hiring process and continuing throughout your career. We also partner with organizations like the National Society of Black Engineers, the Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers, and the Society of Women Engineers to ensure our DEI work is informed by the latest thinking and approaches.   Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives. Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the U.S and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.   Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.

As a Data Protection Engineer in this global organization you will work in our SOC team(engineering solution) to protect global data, including automating backup, recovery and database virtualization. You will be responsible for the key strategy design and delivery of products and services including Data Leakage Prevention (DLP), Information Right Management, Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Token Management, Internet Web authentication and entry security, application security testing and cloud security services. Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems International work environment and flat organisation Great career development opportunities in a growing company Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career Competitive salary Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

Title: Development Engineer (Integration)
Description: Description    Development Engineer (Integration)    Who We Are    Lumileds is the leading global light engine company serving customers in automotive lighting, general illumination, and consumer market segments. Lumileds operates in over 30 countries and has approximately 7,000 employees, Lumileds is shaping the future of light with the most innovative technology in the illumination and automotive sectors, and helping our customers deliver differentiated solutions to the world. Lumileds is headquartered in San Jose, California, with operations in Singapore, Malaysia, China and the Netherlands and sales offices throughout the world.   Together with its customers, Lumileds is making the world better, safer, more beautiful‚Äîwith light.   The Lumileds environment is fast-paced, cutting-edge, intelligent and fun! We are looking for exceptional talent to join our team! To learn more, visit Lumileds.com    What You Will Do    Execute the project on time and deliver results Manage the DOE/qualification lots and cycle time in SG site Perform Yield/FWT/AVI data analysis and troubleshooting Provide project regular update in DDD WW meeting Participate in project/technical discussions with DDD SJ design team and SG module team New product introduction and coordinate/align with DDD WW team, SG Ops/engr, SJ epi-team and L1 PG team    What You Will Bring (Required Qualifications)    Minimum Bachelor of Engineering   3 to 5 years of semiconductor experience LED/semiconductor process technology and understanding in the areas of:   ÔÉò LED basic device physics & Wafer fab process basic knowledge (lithography, film deposition, cleaning & dry/wet etching)   ÔÉò Die fab process basic knowledge (wafer bonding, thinning, CMP, singulation & handling)   ÔÉò Yield/testing/defect screening analysis including FWT & AVI   ÔÉò TFFC process such as GGI, Saber & under-fill (optional)   ÔÉò LED L1 packaging basic knowledge & understanding   ÔÉò Epitaxy-relevant technology (optional)   ÔÉò Deeper R&D experiences for die level developments (preference)   ÔÉò Micro-LED/multiple pixels LED development experience   Skilled in project management processes Possess effective communication skills

Title: Service Ops Engineer
Description: Position Overview  As the Service Operations Engineer, you will be reporting to a Service Operations Manager/Lead. You will support the various hospital systems and its applications. This will include IT operational incidents and management support on day-to-day operational activities to define, implement and continuously optimize service operations process and/or tool to improve business continuity and resiliency.   Role & Responsibilities   Support and assist in regular server maintenance, system accesses, systems monitoring, backups, patching and daily health checks Monitor service level dashboards, perform daily health monitoring, system capacity review and allocation of adequate capacity Assist in investigation of user reported issues Provide support for mission critical systems including, follow up / corrective actions for production issues and defects Maintain service operations documentation, guides, specifications and interfaces between legacy and new systems/data products Create/Update Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) to improve work efficiency Able to provide 24 x7 application support and handle multiple applications    Requirements  Possess a Diploma/Degree Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or any other relevant discipline   Minimum 1-2 years of experience in applications support or similar activities   Experience in MS Windows environment & application support   Apply Now  NOTE: It only takes a few minutes to apply for a meaningful career in HealthTech - GO FOR IT!!

Title: Deals - Data Analytics, Senior Associate
Description: Line of Service  Advisory   Industry/Sector  Not Applicable   Specialism  Data and Analytics Technologies   Management Level  Senior Associate    About PwC    Job Description & Summary  A career at PwC is more than ‚Äújust‚Äù a job. It‚Äôs about being part of a purpose-led firm that builds trust in society and solves important problems. We help our clients to make informed decisions and operate effectively within them. At PwC, we are committed to making a difference for each other, our clients, and our community ‚Äî by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You‚Äôll be able to develop as a leader, be well-connected, work in a great environment, explore our benefits and make a positive contribution.   With PwC, you‚Äôll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture, our Flex policies (Flex Space, Flex Dress and Flex Time), innovative learning and development programs (training programs, digital upscaling) as well as mobility opportunities.   We are seeking a Senior Associate level person to join us in our Deals Data and Analytics practice  Deals Data & Analytics is at the core of analytics within PwC Deals and is poised to be one of our highest growth teams. We focus on the application of leading edge analytical and modelling techniques to help clients make decisions and solve problems. We work on some of the most high-profile deals in the market, across a wide range of clients and sectors.   Deals Data & Analytics sits within the Transaction Services team in Deals and provides support to private equity firms, investment funds and corporate clients through mergers, acquisitions and disposals.   We are now looking to recruit Senior Associates looking for a challenge in deals with a specific focus on Data Analytics. We are looking for a diverse mix of people with a commercial mindset who can quickly get to the crux of business issues and deliver commercially ‚Äúgame changing‚Äù insight to our clients, enhancing value through compelling analysis. If you are naturally inquisitive, have an analytical mind and enjoy solving problems in a rigorous and logical manner, for a variety of different businesses then this is the role for you.    What We Do    Every assignment is different, but we broadly define our offerings under the key headings;   Deal Analytics ‚Äì Using advanced analytical tools to increase confidence both before and during the deal through detailed analysis (customer segmentation, product profitability, pricing etc.) Post Deal - driving performance transparency (strategic planning and reporting) and value creation to support the investment thesis through a technology enabled approach e.g. margin optimisation, strategic options analysis and operational effectiveness. Accelerated Insights - delivering value creation opportunities using intelligent analytics to corporate and portfolio companies (e.g. enabling data driven decision making across sales teams, HR or finance functions)    About The Role    As a Senior Associate you will be supporting a broad range of projects with a specific focus on data analytics. Your first assignment may be working with CFOs or CEOs of leading PE backed or listed businesses to:   Assess shareholder return by implementing rapid analytics to assess the value drivers of the target business; Guide management‚Äôs pricing decisions by evaluating the impact of price on margins and volume; Understand the performance of different customers and products by applying techniques such as cohort analysis and clustering; Implement better data driven decision making within Private Equity backed companies through use-case driven analytics (e.g. Sales team performance and effectiveness dashboards)   Your responsibilities will include but may not be limited to:   Working in multidisciplinary teams directly with our clients to use data analysis and visualisation - either within, before or after a Deal process to answer critical commercial questions Clear and concise communication of complex concepts and their business benefits to senior management (both internally and externally) from a range of backgrounds and business areas to help clients make robust, evidence-based decisions Connecting the dots from disparate information streams (e.g. extracts from client system, management reports etc.) and turning them into structured data that can be analysed as part of a project to provide greater insight to our clients Drafting reports and presentations and using data visualisation to explain our findings Supporting the team to develop and pitch for opportunities    About You    Bachelor‚Äôs degree or above from a reputable university, preferably with specialization in Mathematics, Statistics, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or Business Minimum 5 years of experience (with a minimum of 2 years experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models). Strong experience in using advanced analytics tools (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, PowerBI, Python etc.) Exceptional analytical and technical aptitude, possess both financial and commercial acumen and enjoy problem solving to understand the drivers of a business, analyse their data and use this to provide insight and advice to our clients Have an entrepreneurial mindset and self-starter mentality, and be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity with little supervision to come up with creative solutions to complex problems and develop these ideas into structured deliverable projects Experience in Accounting, Finance, and or Deals environment Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Tableau, QlikView and Power BI. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SQL, etc. Good presentation skills, both oral and written Good client management skills, authoritative and credible in a client conversation - both in terms of personal style and subject matter expertise    PwC Is Able Bring To Those Who Join Us    The opportunity of working hand-in-hand with a strong and fast-growing team of multi-competency advisory professionals amidst an environment of camaraderie and entrepreneurial growth Ability to leverage our Advisory practice that comprises multiple competencies and therefore enables the provision of a more complete solution to clients And last but not the least, access to the global PwC network   Our commitment to you   Our team has constructed sophisticated training programs in order to equip and support commercially minded individuals with best practice techniques through technical training in advanced analytics. Upon joining the team, you will participate in a wide range of training programs, conducted by internal and external specialists, in order to develop your proficiency in data analytics and visualisation tools such as Alteryx, PowerBI and Tableau. These training programs are combined with work shadowing, on the job coaching and an amicable team culture that will support you in developing your skills and career within the team.   We offer opportunities for accelerated personal and professional growth, and a long career at PwC   Only shortlisted candidates will be notified due to the high number of applicants for this role. Yes   Government Clearance Required?  No   Job Posting End Date

Title: Industrial Engineer II
Description: Essential Duties And Responsibilities    Design layout to improve productivity. Provide industrial engineering support (e.g. process flow, layout, new cell setup) for new product from concept to official product launch. Lead in the promotion and implementation of IE techniques and lean tools. Develop and optimize workflow, routings, and operation process using IE/lean tools for higher effectiveness and productivity. Initiate, propose and manage continuous improvement projects and manage timeline closely. Coach stakeholders to strengthen continuous improvement culture. Work closely with ME/TE to improve cycle time. Develop and standardize IE/lean tools where necessary. Develop and automate manual processes using Excel VBA, Power BI or other tools.    Educational/Certification Requirement    Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Electronics /Mechatronics/Industrial and Systems Engineering. Fresh graduate is welcomed to apply. Diploma in Mechanical / Electrical / Electronics / Mechatronics / Industrial and Systems Engineering with minimum 3 years working experience in related field can apply.    Experience Requirement    Minimum 1~2 years relevant experience (3 years for diploma holder) Hand-on experience on using IE tools such as designing layout and capacity studies. Lead continuous improvement projects and have hand-on experience in implementing lean initiative Excellent problem solving, debugging skills, investigative minds and paying attention Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills Independent, self-motivated, ownership, resourceful, process-oriented and result-oriented Possesses drive with ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude Possessing Lean Six Sigma knowledge such as 8D, DMAIC, 8 wastes, 6S and line balancing is a plus Having lean six sigma green belt is a plus Strong project management skills Proficient in data analysis Having strong software and programming skills such as Visio, MS Office, Excel VBA and Power BI is a plus.

Title: Research Assistant (Young Adults Cognition)
Description: The Centre for Lifelong Learning and Individualised Cognition (CLIC) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant.   The Centre for Lifelong Learning and Individualised Cognition (CLIC), funded by the National Research Foundation (NRF) in Singapore and coordinated through the Cambridge Centre for Advanced Research and Education in Singapore (CARES) , is a collaboration between Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and the University of Cambridge. CLIC is a‚ÄØflagship‚ÄØprogramme in the Science of Learning to harness advancements in‚ÄØneuroscience‚ÄØto develop cognitive training programmes  for the improvement of lifelong flexible learning  ,‚ÄØfocusing initially on adolescents and young adults, but also envisaging work with infants and older adults.‚ÄØThis is a strategic global initiative for the Universities of Cambridge‚ÄØand NTU‚ÄØthat brings together multidisciplinary expertise from‚ÄØover 30 investigators‚ÄØin‚ÄØthe‚ÄØareas‚ÄØof   Neuroscience, Psychology, Linguistics and Education across the two universities.   Nanyang Technological University is a research intensive university currently ranked 13th globally and placed 1st amongst the world‚Äôs best young universities. The University has Colleges of Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and an Interdisciplinary Graduate School. Further, the new Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine benefits from a dual campus located at Novena, in close proximity to the Singapore city centre. The Cognitive Neuroimaging Centre (CoNiC) houses state-of-the-art neuroimaging facilities including a newly installed 3T MRI scanner and MEG, as well as new EEG, NIRS, TMS and tDCS equipment.   The first phase of the CLIC program will initially be housed at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. As the programme progresses, other sites will be developed to meet the needs of the experimental programme. The new CLIC research centre will provide a‚ÄØvibrant, fast-paced, international and interdisciplinary‚ÄØenvironment with‚ÄØexcellent‚ÄØopportunities for skills development and knowledge exchange‚ÄØbetween partner Principal Investigator labs in Singapore and Cambridge.   The Principal Investigators involved in the first phase of the research programme include:   From Cambridge  : Director Professor Zoe Kourtzi‚ÄØ(Psychology),‚ÄØSenior Scientific Advisor Professor Trevor Robbins‚ÄØ(Psychology),‚ÄØDeputy Directors‚ÄØProfessor Henriette Hendriks (Linguistics), Professor Michelle Ellefson (Education), and Imaging Lead - Professor John Suckling (Psychiatry); supported‚ÄØby‚ÄØco-Investigators Prof Barbara Sahakian (Psychiatry).   From NTU  :Director Professor Annabel Chen (Psychology), Deputy Director Assoc Prof Victoria Leong (Psychology), Imaging Lead - Professor Bal√°zs Gulyas (LKCMedicine), and Principal Investigators Professor David Hung (NIE) and Assoc Prof Georgios Christopoulos (Nanyang Business School); supported by co-Investigator Dr Teo Chew Lee (NIE).    Key Responsibilities    Participants recruitment, participant handling Manage research data and maintain research records Inform study design and collect primary data Responsible for data coding and entry Conduct analysis of data and summarise research findings Conduct literature reviews for publications and research briefings Assist with preparing academic publications (e.g., journal, conference, book) Contribute to the production of research reports Contribute to the dissemination of research findings Perform other tasks as required by the Principal Investigators Support the recruitment of approximately 400 young adults (18 ‚Äì 30 years) from vocational institutions (e.g. ITE, polytechnics and universities) as well as from the general working population via community sampling (e.g. community centres, clinics, via social media platforms). Organize the collection of datasets Overview and standardize protocols for data coding, data entry and data analysis for the datasets Assist with the preparation of conference presentations journal papers Other administrative duties    Essential Requirements    Diploma, Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Psychology, Neuroscience (Basic, Cognitive or Computational), Economics, Linguistics, Business or related disciplines Good knowledge of statistics and statistical packages, especially R and SPSS Prior experience in conducting, collecting data for and analysing surveys, psychological testing (computerised), behavioural testing and cognitive experiments Experience in producing reports Good IT skills (Office¬Æ) Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills Excellent organizational skills and able to work within given deadlines    Preferred Requirements    Background in factor analytics methods Data management experience with REDCap Training / research experience in experimental, cognitive, or social psychology, psycholinguistics or behavioral economics Research experience / data collection in Singapore is preferred (though not necessary) Prior experience with interdisciplinary work and teams Prior experience working with Singaporean organizations / business Prior experience with academic publication processes and reports Preference for working collaboratively in teams Self-directed learner who effectively picks up relevant skills as needed Experience in acquiring brain imaging data (Optional)We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.Hiring Institution: NTUIn line with Singapore‚Äôs nationwide Vaccination-Differentiated Safe Management Measures (VDS), employees must be fully vaccinated to return to the workplace, unless certified to be medically ineligible. For Information on VDS, please click here .

Title: Research Fellow (Computer Science)
Description: The School of Computer Science and Engineering invites applications for the position of Research Fellow.    Key Responsibilities    Conduct research and development in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning as applied to Computer Vision and Anomaly Detection Generate Intellectual property in the form of Technical disclosures and patents Publish research papers Provide research leadership as well as mentorship to the project team Manage research project    Job Requirements    PhD in Computer Science or related disciplines At least one year of experience in machine learning and deep learning or related areas Good knowledge of Pytorch and Tensorflow Good spoken and written English   Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document.   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.    Hiring Institution: NTU    In line with Singapore‚Äôs nationwide Vaccination-Differentiated Safe Management Measures (VDS), employees must be fully vaccinated to return to the workplace, unless certified to be medically ineligible. Title: DBA (AWS)
Description: Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia (Technology Park)  Are you excited by challenges? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced, international and dynamic environment? Then now is the time to join Quorum Software, a rapidly growing company and industry leader in oil & gas transformation.   Quorum Software is the world's largest provider of digital technology focused solely on business workflows that empower the next evolution of energy. From emerging companies to supermajors, throughout every region of the globe, customers rely on Quorum's proven innovation and unmatched global expertise to streamline business operations and make data-driven decisions that optimize profitability and growth. Our industry-leading solutions are transforming energy companies across the entire value chain, helping visionary leaders evolve their organizations into modern energy companies.   Overview  Quorum Software is seeking a Database Administrator (DBA) to support to support Quorum‚Äôs Energy Components Global Solutions product suite, which monitors business processes for the production, transport and sales of oil and gas, and facilitates collaboration between license holders in oil fields around the world.   Reporting to the Senior System Analyst within Quorum‚Äôs Client Care group this position supports Quorum‚Äôs O&G cloud environments through time critical support responses and troubleshooting; building efficient and scalable solutions; and mentoring and coaching junior team members. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in: Application Management; Access Management; Database Management; Monitoring; Platform Management; Ticketing Tools. This is a permanent role offering challenge and flexible working hours.   Responsibilities   Build, operate and support Quorum‚Äôs O&G cloud environments Deliver Cloud Platform and related services within the SLAs Respond to support requests via tickets and collaboration tools within response time SLAs Troubleshoot performance degradation or loss of service as time critical incidents Building customer solutions, leveraging automation and delivery mechanisms for efficiency and scalability Integrate new projects into the existing platform while maintaining the safety and stability of the system Adopt new technology learning Ownership of issues, including collaboration with other teams and escalations Work shifts (team rotation including weekends to ensure client coverage) Mentoring and coaching junior team members And other duties as assigned.    Application Management   Designing schema, access patterns, locking strategy, SQL development, and tuning. Modifying the database structure Optimizing application and end-user queries (reactive tuning) Archiving data Generating needed ad hoc reports by querying from the database Proactive performance tuning    Access Management   Enrolling users and maintaining system security Controlling user access to the database Locking down host access Securing database privileged credentials (SYSDBA or SYSTEM for Oracle; sa for SQL Server)    Database Management   Parameter configuration and tuning Cache management Job scheduling    Monitoring   Monitoring performance metrics, response times, and request rates Alerting (AWS-RDS) Object access Logs    Platform Management   Ensuring compliance with database vendor license agreement Designing and implementing disaster recovery (DR) solutions Allocating system storage and planning future storage requirements for the database system Installing, upgrading & managing database application Performing data backups Creating, managing, and monitoring high-availability (HA) systems Patching the software that powers your database Troubleshooting DB errors and potentially contacting vendors for technical support Create automation for repeating database tasks AWS Database Migration Service Develop data migration plans to migrate legacy on-premises databases into AWS data stores Work on indexing, replicating, and performing disaster recovery services across multiple AWS regions Writing, designing, testing, implementing, and maintaining database applications using SQL or other database programming languages    Ticketing Tool   Jira Service Now    Requirements   University Degree or Diploma, preferably in a technical discipline (Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, etc.) 5+ years‚Äô experience in the relevant fields Required Certifications: Oracle DBA certified, AWS Certified Database ‚Äì Specialty (DBS-C01), ITIL    Preferred Skills   Experience with DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Terraform, Kubernetes etc. Strong command of SQL and SQL server tools PowerShell and Unix shell scripting skills Familiarity with SSAS, SSIS, SSRS Amazon Aurora, AWS DynamoDB (preferred or NoSQL) Current hands-on working knowledge of AWS Databases such as RDS, RedShift, Aurora. Learns ‚Äì worked on any/all aspects of AWS Databases and storage patterns to include, Amazon Aurora, Relational Database Service (RDS), Dynamo, Redshift, Neptune, TimeSeries, Elasticache and Document DB Certifications in network and cyber security Understanding of Deep Security Knowledge of configuration & integration of tools like Datadog, PagerDuty Process compliance as per SOC2 requirements    Additional Details   Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with Quorum Software in Malaysia is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.    About Quorum Software  Quorum Software connects people and information across the energy value chain. Twenty years ago, we built the first software for gas plant accountants. Pipeline operators came next, followed by land administrators, pumpers, and planners. Since 1998, Quorum has helped thousands of energy workers with business workflows that optimize profitability and growth. Our vision for the future connects the global energy ecosystem through cloud-first software, data standards, and integration. The trusted source of decision-ready data for 1,800+ companies, Quorum Software makes the essential connections that let us work better together in the connected energy workplace. For more information, visit quorumsoftware.com.

Title: Digital Solutions- Data Engineer, Manager/ Assistant Manager
Description: Line of Service  Assurance   Industry/Sector  TMT X-Sector   Specialism  Technology Strategy   Management Level  Manager    About PwC    Job Description & Summary  A career at PwC is more than ‚Äújust‚Äù a job. It‚Äôs about being part of a purpose-led firm that builds trust in society and solve important problems. We help our clients to make informed decisions and operate effectively within them. At PwC, we are committed to making a difference for each other, our clients, and our community ‚Äî by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You‚Äôll be able to develop as a leader, be well-connected, work in a great environment, explore our benefits and make a positive contribution.   With PwC, you‚Äôll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture, our Flex policies (Flex Space, Flex Dress and Flex Time), innovative learning and development programs (training programs, digital upscaling) as well as mobility opportunities. If you would like to be connected to like-minded individuals outside of work, we highly encourage you to be part of our people clubs and committees such as the Sports and Recreational Club, Toastmasters Club and more!   Business Function  A career in our Digital Platforms and Multi Channel Customer Solutions practice, within Technology Strategy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations develop strategies that transform their technology capabilities and solve their most critical challenges. We focus on building technology enabled and agile operating models, planning their new enterprise architecture into a differentiating capability system that helps them win in the market, leveraging digital analytics to enhance the customer experience and optimising business operations, and using modern management techniques such as robotic process automation and next generation sourcing strategies to help our clients get fit for growth.   In joining, you‚Äôll be a part of a team that provides practical, yet holistic, answers that help client cut through the noise and decide what to do with their customer relationship management processes, technology and investments. You‚Äôll help our clients achieve essential advantage through creative digital strategies and better Information Technology management techniques.   You will join our data scientists and product owners in realising authentic, data-driven change and solutions across the lifecycle of our projects.    How Will You Value Add    3-5 year experience in using Data Engineering to solve meaningful business problems internally and for our clients Designing and building data pipelines to support data science projects including improving data foundational procedures, integrating new data management technologies and software into the existing system and building data collection pipelines Assessing and documenting multiple datasets before consolidation and support feature engineering. Ability to design and build data warehouses, data lakes and data marts. Participating in constant learning through training and skills development Demonstrable experience in data intensive projects (professional, academic or personal), particularly where focused on a business need Delivery of solutions through the entire lifecycle from data sourcing to results Good understanding of data engineering, software engineering, or release engineering techniques Able to articulate complex data concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences Empathic listener and persuasive speaker Ability to work with product owners to translate requirements Experience of business analysis tasks and approaches    About You    Strong programming experience in Python Experience of developing in cloud environments (Azure, GCP, AWS) Experience with SQL databases (Postgres, SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle) Experience with NoSQL databases (Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Neo4J) Experience of the Linux ecosystem and container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) Software engineering experience (Git, Continuous Integration/Deployment, Software Testing) Knowledge of Information Security practices, especially in a Cloud environment Cloud fundamental or architect accreditations Experience with API development Experience working with big data technologies (Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Apache Drill, Presto, Redshift or similar) Programming experience in a JVM language (Java, Scala, Kotlin) Demonstrable experience in project management and leading teams A mature understanding of business operations   Only shortlisted candidates will be notified due to the high number of applicants for this role   There have been reports of scammers impersonating PwC HR professionals contacting individuals about fraudulent job opportunities using non-PwC domain email addresses and an overseas number. Please note that genuine communications from our HR team will only come from "@pwc.com" email address   Education  (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)   Degrees/Field Of Study Required    Degrees/Field of Study preferred:   Certifications  (if blank, certifications not specified)   Optional Skills    Required Skills  Desired Languages  (If blank, desired languages not specified)   Travel Requirements    Not Specified   Available for Work Visa Sponsorship? Title: Data Analyst, Marketing - Groceries (APAC)
Description: foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores ‚Äî foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!   We are looking for enthusiastic problem solvers to join us in scaling our platform, to digitalise businesses in Asia, uplift rider livelihoods and build a hyper-convenient platform for our customers. If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. Our diverse and high-performing team comprises people from more than 60 nationalities, and we welcome all experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives. Up for an exciting new career?   We are currently hiring for a Data Analyst for our Groceries vertical to join our growing regional APAC Marketing team, based in Singapore. This is a key role driving data analytics behind APAC-wide decisions for foodpanda‚Äôs business.    Responsibilities    Work with key business stakeholders and regional data team (data analysts, data engineers, machine learning engineers) to deliver insights, reports, visualization, analysis and predictive models to solve important business problems and optimize growth opportunities Be passionate about working with big data to define, implement and monitor business KPIs, as well as to provide data driven insights to the business Perform deep analytical dives into problems to troubleshoot and identify root causes and find solutions Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support cross functional projects, especially with product team (specialists & analytics)    Requirements    4+ years experience in data analytics / business intelligence Ability to write clean, structured, and high performance SQL codes (preferable BigQuery) and experienced with BI Tools (Tableau, Data Studio) Working knowledge of Python in addition to algorithms & data structures is a must Strong business mindset and ability to grasp business requirements from stakeholders Champion of data and visualization with strong presentation and story-telling skills Strong oral and written communication skills Knowledge of Q-commerce is a plus    What We Offer    A dynamic and challenging work environment. A company committed to developing you personally and professionally. A great working atmosphere with regular company and team events. A vibrant and international team committed to diversity and inclusion. Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company. Other benefits include free food, health and dental insurance, and learning and development opportunities!   foodpanda is operated by the Delivery Hero Group (‚ÄúDH Group‚Äù), the global leader in the food delivery industry, processing over 4 million orders daily, operating in 40+ markets, with over 25,000 employees and approximately 600,000+ restaurant partners worldwide.

Title: Senior/Principal Analyst [Data Engineer]
Description: Be Transformational.   Make your mark. Create an impact.    At IRAS, we partner you to deliver quality tax services and foster a competitive tax environment for our nation's social and economic growth. By leveraging digital capabilities as part of a future-ready team, your opportunities keep expanding.  As a Senior/Principal Analyst (Data Engineer), you have good interpersonal skills, an analytical mind and a curiosity for all things data and digital. At IRAS, you will have the space to explore rich income and tax data sets in Singapore and drive our digital transformation journey by creating and delivering impactful solutions across the organisation. You will leverage digital tools and use data intelligently to re-engineer business processes and produce insights for smarter decision-making.    The result? Your mark of insight stamped on digital solutions.     What you will be working on   To assess and implement robust and scalable big data technologies/architectures to enable optimal data generation, extraction, transformation and storage from a wide variety of data sources To engineer, optimise, fine-tune and maintain efficient, secure and reliable data pipelines to ingest, clean and consolidate data sources into the analytics systems and solutions To build and maintain an efficient, scalable and future-proof deployment infrastructure to enable the development and deployment of production quality analytics and AI applications To work with data scientists to productionise and maintain analytics/ artificial intelligence solutions (e.g. applications, models) by integrating them into business processes. This includes converting proof-of-concepts developed by data scientists into production-grade products and converting machine learning models in Application Program Interfaces (APIs) Work with internal and external stakeholders on data management solutions from inception to implementation (including data discovery, data quality, metadata management, data extraction and data governance solutions) To conduct research on emerging big data architecture, technologies and systems and data management technologies to ensure that they continue to support the requirements of the data scientists and the business stakeholders in the mid to long-term To provide technical guidance to junior data analysts/engineers on complex data issues, handling of big data sets and use of advanced methodologies     What we are looking for   Background in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, equivalent fields or proven experience in data engineering At least 5 years of experience in data engineering and AI, which includes developing and maintaining data, AI infrastructure and pipelines that use big data and/or cloud platforms Proficiency in SQL, Spark, Python is a must. Experience in Hadoop, Scala, DAX, TensorFlow, C++/C#, etc. is a plus Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. Azure), modelling data for analytics and with DevOps, ModelOps, automation, containerization is preferred Candidates with prior experience in data management technologies will have an added advantage Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to explain technical solutions to the business users and partners Good coaching skills. Able to provide effective guidance to junior team members.    All new appointees will be appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance. You may wish to be informed that your vaccination status will be a consideration for recruitment purposes.    Please submit your resume via Careers@Gov. We regret to inform that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Title: Research Librarian (Law), SMU Libraries
Description: About Us    Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together ‚Äì building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.   Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities ‚Äì all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.    Job Description    The SMU Libraries invites dynamic, creative and service-oriented individuals to apply for the position of Research Librarian, Law. You will be part of an innovative and collaborative team, delivering high quality services as the first line of contact to assist SMU faculty, staff and students in meeting their research, teaching and learning needs. The primary focus of this position is to be the liaison for faculty and students from the SMU‚Äôs Yong Pung How School of Law (YPHSL) and related programmes in order to support and advance their research, teaching and learning goals in close collaboration with the Lead, Learning Services and School Partnerships. You will work in a team environment to create and develop innovative library products and services for the SMU community and to pro-actively promote initiatives and programmes of the SMU Libraries through engagement.    Responsibilities    Develop, grow, and sustain partnerships with faculty, researchers, students, and staff in the Yong Pung How School of Law (YPHSL); develop and promote high quality library services for the YPHSL and affiliated units. Seek new opportunities and build on existing offerings for engagement with faculty and students. Attend School and University-wide events and programmes to network and champion the SMU Libraries. Create, coordinate, and conduct formal learning opportunities (e.g., workshops, talks, etc.) in collaboration with faculty to grow students‚Äô information and digital literacy capabilities. Curate and create digital guides and learning objects for self-directed learning. Provide research services to faculty and students including research skills, research data and scholarly communication support leveraging on other departments within the libraries. Initiate, develop, manage, and review new and existing programmes and services for the SMU community as part of the SMU Libraries team Work across Library units to build and manage the SMU Library‚Äôs collections relevant to the legal discipline and the Yong Pung How School of Law (YPHSL). Work with key units within the SMU Library to integrate research output and research data of the Yong Pung How School of Law (YPHSL) and related Institutes and Centers into SMU‚Äôs Institutional Repository (InK) and Research Data Repository (RDR). Collaborates with the coordinators for postgraduate services and faculty teaching support. Assess and evaluate services, resources, and tools for targeted user groups, in particular the Yong Pung How School of Law (YPHSL). Lead and/or participate in Library-wide initiatives and projects and collaborate with colleagues internal and external to the SMU Libraries. Engage in continuous, self-reflective professional development. Participate in professional activities relating to librarianship. Contribute to the profession and beyond through writing and presenting in a variety of contexts. Maintain current awareness of trends in libraries and higher education.  Qualification & Skills   Master‚Äôs degree in Library and Information Science with a minimum of two years‚Äô experience in an academic library. Undergraduate degree or diploma in law or related subject area is strongly preferred. Advanced knowledge of specialized legal resources such as LawNet, Westlaw, Lexis Advance, and multidisciplinary academic databases. Understanding of research issues, such as open access, publishing, and research visibility and impact in the higher education environment, especially as relevant to legal education. Proven ability to continuously innovate services and processes, particularly through the use of current and emerging technologies. Experience with data analysis packages e.g., statistical packages and survey analysis packages is advantageous. Proven ability to design, deliver and evaluate information and digital literacy programmes for individuals and groups at different levels. Demonstrated ability to initiate and build collaborative relationships with stakeholders, particularly faculty and students. Strong customer service orientation. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). Ability to be flexible and adaptable and contribute to a diverse team of staff in a dynamic environment. Personal strengths should include critical thinking, interest in innovation, and flexibility with ability to work in a team with minimum supervision.   Details about the position are available at Job Description: Research Librarian, Law  .    How To Apply    Interested applicants, please email your resume with a covering letter to libjob@smu.edu.sg. The covering letter must state the applicants‚Äô responses to the selection criteria. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.    Other Information    Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.
